intro: Mesembryanthemum copiosum, commonly known as the common ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and coastal environments due to its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and yellow, bloom in response to sunlight and often close at night. Mesembryanthemum copiosum is also known for its ability to spread rapidly through its creeping growth habit and is often used in xeriscaping.
